block.p: Melinda Anne Mulcahey, the daughter of Nancy J. Gaffney of Ho Ho Kus, N.J., was married yesterday to Douglas John Cronk, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas F. Cronk of Suffern, N.Y. The Rev. James P. Whelan performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of the Nativity in Midland Park, N.J.

Mrs. Cronk, 29, is a director of public affairs at the American Express Company in New York. She graduated from Allegheny College and received a master's degree in public relations from Syracuse University. Her mother is an independent management consultant and a former senior vice president, in Paramus, N.J., of the vendor services division of the Green Tree Financial Corporation. The bride's stepfather, Michael P. Gaffney, is the Northeast regional vice president of the Fleet Capital Corporation in Providence.

Melinda Anne Mulcahey, the daughter of Nancy J. Gaffney of Ho Ho Kus, N.J., was married yesterday to Douglas John Cronk, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas F. Cronk of Suffern, N.Y. The Rev. James P. Whelan performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of the Nativity in Midland Park, N.J.

Mrs. Cronk, 29, is a director of public affairs at the American Express Company in New York. She graduated from Allegheny College and received a master's degree in public relations from Syracuse University. Her mother is an independent management consultant and a former senior vice president, in Paramus, N.J., of the vendor services division of the Green Tree Financial Corporation. The bride's stepfather, Michael P. Gaffney, is the Northeast regional vice president of the Fleet Capital Corporation in Providence.

Mr. Cronk, 28, is an associate at Brown Brothers Harriman & Company, a private bank in New York. His mother, Sharon A. Cronk, is a nurse in the dialysis unit of Good Samaritan Hospital in Suffern. His father is an independent contractor in Suffern specializing in house renovation.
